question: Who created Git?
options: Julian Assange
Linus Torvalds
Bill Gates
Mark Zuckerberg

question: What is the 80/20 principle in project management?
options: 80% of people do 20% of the work
80% of projects fail because of 20% of the requirements
80% of work takes 20% of the time, and 20% of work takes 80% of the time
80% of work should be done by the deadline, 20% after
answer: 80% of work takes 20% of the time, and 20% of work takes 80% of the time

question: What is spiral development?
options: A planning technique using spiral diagrams
A project management style developed by the US Department of Defense
A development approach where you work through requirements in a spiral pattern
An iterative approach where each cycle produces a complete working product before adding features
answer: An iterative approach where each cycle produces a complete working product before adding features

question: What is the difference between demand-side and supply-side time management?
options: Demand-side focuses on urgent tasks, supply-side on important ones
Demand-side is for short-term projects, supply-side for long-term ones
Demand-side does tasks in sequence until time runs out, supply-side divides available time among tasks
Demand-side is used in business, supply-side in education
answer: Demand-side does tasks in sequence until time runs out, supply-side divides available time among tasks

question: Which of these is NOT a function of Git according to the lecture?
options: Managing history
Designing interfaces
Pushing and pulling
Branching and merging

question: What is triage in project management?
options: Breaking down a project into smaller components
Determining which resources to allocate to different parts of a project
Identifying which team members to assign to each task
Deciding which tasks to prioritize, which to abandon, and which can wait
answer: Deciding which tasks to prioritize, which to abandon, and which can wait

question: What is the recommended approach to documentation during Fab Academy?
options: Only document the successful parts of your work
Have someone else document your work while you focus on technical aspects
Document everything at the end of the week before submission
Document as you go, making it part of your daily work cycle
answer: Document as you go, making it part of your daily work cycle

question: Why does the instructor recommend keeping file sizes small in the repository?
options: Because large files are more likely to be corrupted
To make backups easier to create
For archival purposes and responsive website performance
To save personal storage space on your computer
answer: For archival purposes and responsive website performance

question: What does WYSIWYG stand for?
options: Where Your System Is Working Good
When You Share Information With Your Group
Why You Should Install Web Graphics
What You See Is What You Get
answer: What You See Is What You Get
